sense.name: a messenger deployed on a mission on behalf of someone else
sense.examples: Several European nations are sending high-ranking emissaries to the state funeral. She has been an effective emissary for their charitable causes in poor parts of the world.

sense.name: a secret agent, spy
sense.commentary: EMISSARY[+person][+spy] [+relation][+role][+agent][+espionage] Note: can convey a pejorative connotation, unlike Sense 1
sense.examples: The dictator accused their embassy of harboring emissaries of the enemy. He had worked as an emissary during the Cold War, posing as a school teacher.
